alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 3:04PM CDT until April 21 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Topeka KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Black Vermillion River near Frankfort affecting Marshall County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Vermillion River near Frankfort. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowland areas occurs along the river from Vermillion to the mouth of the Black Vermillion River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 19.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/top/.
